sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's Friday the 4th of February. Good morning Europe. Thanks for joining us here on Euronews. The headlines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Washington is accusing Moscow of planning to fake a video as a pretext into starting a conflict with Ukraine, which Russia denies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The US has come under criticism over the killing of an ISIS leader, as it's reported around 10 civilians were killed too.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And we look at how women in Kenya are turning fish skins into shoes and products as a way to make a living and reduce waste.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Washington accuses Moscow of planning to fake a video as a pretext for an invasion of Ukraine by staging fabricated attacks by Ukrainian military.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This claim comes amid tensions over the Russian troop buildup around the Ukrainian border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The production of this propaganda video is one of a number of options that the Russian government is developing as a fake pretext to initiate and potentially justify military aggression against Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We don't know if Russia will necessarily use this or another option in the coming days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We are publicizing it now, however, in order to lay bare the extent of Russia's destabilizing actions towards Ukraine and to dissuade Russia from continuing this dangerous campaign and ultimately launching a military attack. However, Moscow denies they are planning any such thing. The Kremlin has blamed the U.S. and NATO of undermining the region's security. Russia has called on the U.S. to de-escalate after Biden announced he will deploy 3,000 extra troops in Eastern Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russia and Belarus will soon start their joint military drills next week, but it comes as Ukraine has lived with the threat of a Russian incursion since 2014.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: On Thursday, the Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelensky welcomed Turkish President Erdogan into the standoff situation between Kiev and Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: As an ally of both Putin and Zelensky, Erdogan has offered to host a Ukraine-Russia crisis summit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: U.S. officials are being quoted as having obtained intelligence that Russia was planning on staging a fake attack,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: filming it and using the video as a pretext to invade Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: According to that intelligence, Russia had already started hiring actors for the video that would also feature fake Ukrainian military equipment and depict an attack on Russian soil or against Russian speakers in the east of Ukraine. That would of course feed the narrative that Moscow has been putting forward that Russia is under threat and justify military action. Russia has for a while now denied it has plans to invade this country but has also refused to explain the buildup of troops on the border with Ukraine, saying that whatever it does with its soldiers, it's no one else's businesses. The intelligence provided by Americans also indicates that Russia was planning on involving Turkish drones on that staged attack in order to fully implicate NATO.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: That, of course, as the Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan came here to the Ukrainian capital Kyiv to pay a visit to his Ukrainian counterpart, Volodymyr Zelensky, and to show support to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Erdogan also offered to mediate the crisis and to host a Ukraine-Russia summit in order to defuse tensions and to avoid a war between what he described as two important friends.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Anneliese Borges from the Ukrainian capital Kiev for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The US has come under criticism after killing ISIS leader Abu Ibrahim al-Hashimi al-Quraishi in Syria. In the raid led by special forces, it's reported more than 10 civilians were killed too.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The attack is still being investigated, but so far it is understood that the terrorist detonated an explosive device which caused the building he was in to collapse. A senior deputy of the terror group is also thought to be dead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Our team is still compiling the report but we do know that as our troops approach to capture the terrorist and a final act of desperate cowardness, he, with no regard to the lives of his own family or others in the building, he chose to blow himself up, not just to the vest, but to blow up that third floor, rather than face justice for the crimes he has committed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We remain vigilant. We remain prepared.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Last night's operation took a major terrorist leader off the battlefield and it sent a strong message to terrorists around the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We will come after you and find you." The killing of the Islamic State leader is the biggest raid outside the US since 2019, when the US Special Forces killed the terrorist group's former leader, al-Baghdadi.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The raid took place on the outskirts of the opposition-held town of Atman, close to the Turkish border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Well, the fallout from the political instability in Northern Ireland continues in Brussels today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We know that the Northern Ireland agricultural minister, Edwin Poots, decided he was no longer going to support checks on goods coming from Great Britain to Northern Ireland, which is the Northern Ireland Protocol, which is international law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It's part of the EU-UK withdrawal agreement on Brexit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: On the ground, the EU says those checks are still taking place, but the position is also that it's the UK's responsibility to ensure the Northern Ireland Protocol is implemented.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Brussels sources, your news of spoken to, said that if the UK doesn't do so, that there can be sanctions, such as a partial suspension of the trade agreement between the EU and the UK.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Yesterday, Maro Sefcovic, the EU-British negotiator, met with his counterpart, Liz Truss.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: They had talks, but the progress of those talks was minimal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The EU describes the whole situation as unhelpful 24 hours before the official start of the Winter Olympic Games Beijing

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: residents gathered around a countdown clock in a busy shopping district in a busy shopping district. Although the first opening events took place on Wednesday, the opening ceremony is scheduled today at 8 p.m. local time, 1 p.m. Central European time. In some other world cities, some groups weren't so eager for the games to happen. In San Francisco, a coalition group including Uyghurs and people from Hong Kong and Tibet protested on the Golden Gate Bridge and urged people to ignore the events. A demonstrator asked athletes to decline the medals, calling them bloodshed medals. In Europe, hundreds of Tibetans and supporters gathered outside the Swiss headquarters of the International Olympic Committee in Lausanneanne they held banners saying boycott beijing winter olympics and games of shame some countries have stated they will not send diplomats to the olympics colombian transit police have seized 120 kilograms of cocaine

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: from an ambulance in the country's northwest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: An alleged doctor traveling inside the vehicle initially told officers he was carrying a COVID-19 patient in an attempt to stop a search.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In total, 60 packages filled with the drug were found.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: So far, five people linked to the ambulance have been placed in custody.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez has secured last-minute backing for a key labour reform requested by Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The reform is expected to help end job insecurity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Lacking support from traditional allies, it was pushed through by the liberal Ciudadanos and some centre-right lawmakers, with a majority of just one vote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Despite taking effect on January 1, the reforms still required parliamentary approval.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: At least 12 people of the French Indian Ocean Territory of La RÃ©union were injured after the tropical cyclone Batsirai battered the island, hitting it with torrential rains and powerful winds.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Authorities decided to keep the island on red alert for more than 24 hours, forcing its nearly 900,000 residents to barricade themselves indoors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A night of shattered hopes in Cameroon after the pharaohs of Egypt booked their place for

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: the final match of the afghan 2021 competition at the expense of their hosts neither team managed to open the score during regulation time and extra time and had to go through a penalty shoot out the pharaohs relied on the talent of their number two goalkeeper mohamed abu gabal also known as gabaski who stopped three of the four cameroonian shots on goal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Egypt will now try to win an eight African Cup of Nations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: They will face Senegal on Sunday, who have more news from across Europe after this break.
